reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: Huge room, great space, nicely decorated. Beautiful lobby and nice and popular bar, Havana bar. My only criticism of the hotel was when I was trying to get a taxi to catch a 5pm train. As another reviewer pointe dout its only about 20 mins walk to train statuon but my bag was heavy. I booked a taxi for 3.30 and at 4.10 I was told that it was "shift change time" and they didnt now if they would be able to get me a taxi. At 4.20 they said I would be better to get a bus....not very happy...they should have told me at first instance that 3.30 was shift change time...
reviews.title: Great hotel..beware of difficulty of taxis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: But other than that they were great..concierge remembered my nam,e, food was excellent and only 20 mins walk to bell tower, drum tower, city walls and KFC..unless theres one I didnt know about its about 20mins walk too. Also Starbucks in same area! Which is nice!
reviews.title: Weird shaped room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: I had an unusual shaped room with basically a bed, nice window seat over looking the square, a cupboard containing an old style big TV. Around the corner was a small desk and then there was a side room with a safe, ironing board and room for my suitcase. There was definitely not enough room for the suitcase in the bedroom which made it slightly inconvenient. From looking at the floor plan not all rooms are this shape. The bathroom was fine but again, a slightly strange lay out and because they encased the shower and loo in glass cubicles it made it very cramped. So cramped that it was hard to get out of the loo stall. The sink area was very cramped too and so there was not really enough room for a washbag and its contents. Again, the bed was very hard, as they all are in China - I had hoped that by staying at 5 star Western chain hotels they'd be softer - no such luck! The breakfast was about fifteen pounds which was expensive but there was a good range of stuff on offer and at least the pastries were fresh unlike the stale offerings I had at the Peninsula in Beijing! However it involved a long walk 10-15 minute walk to the other building which was a bore when you have an early start. They also charge for the internet which is frustrating when it would be free if you had a laptop in your room. I was able to watch people doing tai chi in silk outfits on the square opposite before heading off to bike around the old city walls.
reviews.title: A really beautiful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: This hotel looks onto quite an impressive square with a fountain - fortunately i had a room overlooking it. It is in a good position - you can walk to the Bell and Drum Towers, Great Mosque and Muslim Street area.
reviews.title: not bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived at the Sofitel, our room was not ready for check-in. It took them longer than promised to get it ready, but we sat outside in a paved courtyard area and waited. We started out waiting in the lobby, but the furniture in there wasn't that comfortable. The sofas were fine, but the chairs were aggressively modern looking and not that nice to sit in. Once we were given keys to our room, however, I fell in love with it. It had a curtained window seat, a red velvet settee in the seating area, other velvet upholstery, and a glass-walled bathroom with a rain showerhead. We like hotels with this kind of decor, but I can understand that some may find it to be too bold for their liking.
reviews.title: Modern Interior, Good Location
Not overly impressed
reviews.text: The Sofitel is walking distance (if you like to walk) to many of the Xi'an sights: the Bell Tower and Drum Tower, a night market, and the city wall. There are also some great restaurants (RBT, De Fa Cheng dumpling restaurant) within an easy walk of the hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sofitel staff helped us to arrange a private guide for a tour of the Terracotta Warriors and several other sights, and that worked out perfectly. Everyone was friendly and extremely helpful.
reviews.title: Dirty rooms...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006
reviews.text: Breakfast at the Sofitel was excellent, offering both Asian and Western options. Everything was served buffet-style, so you were free to compose a plate of whatever you wanted, Asian or Western. I would consider staying at the Sofitel again if I were to return to Xi'an.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
Very good!
reviews.text: Wasn't too impressed with this hotel. It was OK but nothing special. Room was a good size but, like the rest of the hotel, could do with a bit of an update decor wise. Carpet looked like it had seen better days. Staff were friendly and service at breakfast etc good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on a whistle stop one day tour in October 2009, initially I had checked the pricing and was a little dubious that I could get a suite at what was about £120 gbp, $260 usd at the time. However we took the plunge and believe me was not dissappointed!. Before i go on I will add I spend approx 25% of my life in hotel rooms so I would like to say I am well qualified, however so as not to mislead we do usually pick suites so my room description is only comparing againt suites. My main thing I would say before boring you with detail is definitely to pay a little extra here and choose a suite as usualy the price differences are massive and here they seem not to be.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel, fantastic service, great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The suite room on the 12th floor, room 51219 was fabulous, not too big and not too small, it was one room rather than the silly 2 rooms where you never use the second room and designed perfectly, a seperate sofa area, seperate desk area and a huge bed. Again a practical bathroom not too big not too small, seperate shower, bath toilet etc and fit out to very very high standards.
reviews.title: Looks great, but the experience is a let-down.

An oasis in Xi'an
reviews.text: I was looking for a little luxury as I have been staying in a small town in China with very basic accomodations. This hotel may not be anything special from the outside, but inside it is definitely a 5-star hotel. Additionally, I booked it for a great rate online on their own website. The staff are very helpful and helped me check-in quickly, even though I arrived well before the check-in time. They gave me tips for travelling around town in terms of transport and sightseeing. The room was spotless and was the luxury I was looking for; very clean, great decor and bedding, good A/C (it was 97F when i went in the summer!), immaculate bathroom, and there was even a turndown service. I happened upon the Hyatt while I was walking around town and didn't think it was in as good of a location (much too busy and noisy) or as modern as the Sofitel. The Sofitel is set back from the street so you don't hear much of the noise, and is part of a hotel complex that also includes the People's hotel and Grand Mercure so the grounds are very well kept even as you step out of the hotel. The gym and pool are fantastic, and there's a spa service as well. They made my stay in Xi'an as enjoyable as possible, and it was a great deal money-wise. All the good things said about this hotel are definitely true! I think the reason it is so well-run is because it is managed by a non-Chinese entity, which makes sure that it adheres to high international standards. You'll want to go back again after you stay the first time.

reviews.text: Every hallway and room looks like a photo from a design magazine. We felt incredibly pampered by the attentive staff. We would definitely return.
reviews.title: Sofitel living up to its promise
Best in town
reviews.text: That said, you have to be prepared for some non-western details. Prominently discussed among our group members was the clear glass wall between the shower and the beds. If you wish for a tad of privacy ask for a room with frosted glass. Even worse, it is possible to look through the all-glass shower from the beds and also see the toilet in its all-glass enclosure. There are some things I would prefer not to watch. However, the hotel has replaced the clear glass with frosted glass in its double rooms and is working on the rest.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: The hotel has an able assistant manager from Portland, Oregon, who is very responsive to the need to tweak some changes. According to our tour guide, who stayed in 2005, the oddities have disappeared. The laundry rates are now reasonable and the spa rates a bargain for a top level hotel. The buffet has a very good mix of cuisines. The menus are also varied. Our room was quiet, comfortable and elegant.The historic grounds are lovely to stroll in the morning.
reviews.title: Great hotel
Best hotel on our trip, but not perfect
reviews.text: I just stayed in this hotel in June 2006 with seven of my family members, and I think we'd all agree that the place was fabulous. The hotel is brand new, very clean, provides great service, and has lots of eating/drinking options (Japanese, Moroccan, Western, Cantonese). In short, it is hands down the best place in Xi'an for those who are looking for upscale accommodations. We had a large group, so we rented a hotel van for three days to take us around to all the local sites (terracotta warriors, Hua Shan, etc.). The van was a bit on the pricey side (800Y/day), but when split eight ways it was relatively reasonable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006
reviews.text: This is a super hotel and much to our regret, we only spent one night here. Very modern decor and very stylish - not for those who prefer wood veneer over glass and marble. Previous reviews seem overly vexed about the bathroom so I thought I'd take a photo for trip advisor. Nothing too weird and I definitely wouldn't say no to it in my own house. In terms of location, the hotel is approx an hour away (taxi fare 140 RMB inc the toll for the express way) and an hour or so away from the terracotta army (taxi 200 RMB) but hail a minibus down to take you back to Xian city for 8RMB!
reviews.title: So loved the Sofitel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sofitel is in a courtyard with four other hotels in the centre of Xian. It is five-star modern luxury - esepcially on the executive club floors. The big bedrooms have everything the traveller could wish for - but the glass fronted bathrooms and toilet faciltiies are not for those of a modest or retiring nature! Not the place to take your maiden aunt. Helpful staff, many of them English-speaking. One restaurant but excellent choice of cuisines. Great place for a visit to the Terra Cotta warriors.
reviews.title: Transparent luxury

aka: Sofitel Xian On Renmin Square Hotel Xi`An
description: The majestic Sofitel Xian On Renmin Square locates right in the heart of its walled city. It is in the hotel complex of beautifully landscaped gardens stand a series of historical buildings of Sino-Russian architecture echoing more than 50 years of history. The 414 spacious guestrooms equipped with ultra-modern conveniences - the exclusive Sofitel's MY BED, rainforest shower, complimentary wireless Internet access. For the busy executive traveller requiring extra efficiency, the Club Sofitel has 56 rooms and suites with upgraded facilities, services and exclusive benefits. Azur delights with fresh, savory Mediterranean dishes and European specialties. At the Casablanca, experience authentic Moroccan dishes. Koi, our Japanese Restaurant is the very best in Japanese cuisine with an elegant atmosphere. Le Chinois is the most prestigious Cantonese restaurant in the city. Bar Bambu is the lobby bar with romantic live music, and you can also enjoy the international music our Habana Club of finest wine and cigars.
